executive_summary:
Figures have been adjusted for inflation and are presented in 2022 currency.

The Private Detective Services industry offers investigation services, including surveillance, fraud investigation and pre-employment screening, to both private citizens and corporate entities. Operators in this industry do not provide patrol or security guard services. The industry performed relatively well over much of the five years to 2020, as the growing economy enabled businesses and consumers to enlist the wide range of services provided by industry operators. Corporate profit and per capita disposable income growth enabled businesses and households to boost spending on discretionary services like those provided by industry operators. However, the outbreak of the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic negatively affected the industry in 2020, as a large economic contraction led to a sharp decline in downstream demand. While this temporarily limited demand, the recovery of the economy since has returned the industry to growth. Consequently, IBISWorld expects industry revenue to grow at an annualized rate of 1.0% to $7.3 billion over the five years to 2022, including 2.1% growth during the current year.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Corporate profit grew substantially in 2017 and 2018
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: increasing businesses' ability to pay for investigative services. Whether it be for litigation or with the purpose of simply gathering information, private detective services help businesses by collecting information that is unavailable through other channels. Following a contraction in 2020, corporate profit surged more than 20.0% in 2021. As a result, industry profit, defined as earnings before interest and taxes, has recovered and is expected to reach 5.5% of revenue in 2022.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Industry revenue expected to grow at 1.7% annually over next 5 years
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Over the five years to 2027, industry revenue is expected to grow at an annualized rate of 1.7% to total $7.9 billion. Rising corporate profit, as well as increases in per capita disposable income and the number of businesses, are expected to drive this growth, as both consumers and businesses become better equipped to afford industry services. Growing downstream demand is expected to counter continued growth in labor costs, causing profit to stagnate. However, declining divorce and crime rates are expected to limit growth during the period because these are crucial drivers for the industry. Regardless, improving economic conditions and the continued rise in the popularity of pre-employment screening will outweigh negative trends and drive growth.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Demand for industry services is expected to grow over the next five years, largely driven by the corporate and legal clients. Corporate profit is expected to increase at an annualized rate of 3.0% over the five years to 2027, which is expected to positively affect industry revenue during the period. Furthermore, the number of businesses is forecast to increase at an annualized rate of 0.9% over the next five years. An increasing number of businesses will likely boost expenditure on legal- and business-related private detective services.

The level of demand from consumers is another factor that is anticipated to influence industry performance moving forward. Per capita disposable income is expected to rise at an annualized rate of 1.7% over the five years to 2027. Increasing levels of income are expected to influence consumers' desire to use industry services. However, the divorce rate, which measures the number of divorces per 1,000 people, is expected to decline at an annualized rate of 4.1% over the five years to 2027. This rate coincides closely with consumer demand for industry services since consumers that suspect infidelity often use private detectives to gather information.

industry_definition: This industry comprises companies and individuals that provide investigation and detective services for corporate entities and private citizens. This industry does not include operators that mainly provide guard and patrol services and armored car services.
key_trends: A rising number of businesses has boosted demand for industry services
Demand from consumers has been increasing over the past five years
Rising wages over the past five years have negatively affected profit
Increasing levels of income are expected to influence consumers' desire to use services
A recovering business environment is expected to attract new operators
The cost of entering the industry is expected to decrease during the outlook period
Corporate profit and per capita disposable income growth have enabled businesses to boost spending on discretionary services

regulations_points.regulation_description: Each state has its own laws governing the industry, and in most states industry operators need a state license to legally work as private investigators.
Private detectives must also follow all relevant firearm regulations if they choose to carry one.
The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) has released guidelines for businesses regarding COVID-19, such as employee separation and flexible sick leave policies.

barriers_points.barrier_description: The industry is mature, increasing barriers.
Low and steady industry assistance level.

basis_points.basis_description: Industry operators serving private individuals compete heavily on price due to hourly billing.
Private detectives compete on reputation and experience, leveraging long operating history.
Detectives compete on how quickly they can complete jobs to service more clients.

basis_points.basis_title: Evidence gathering capabilities for corporate clients
basis_points.basis_description: For corporate clients, detectives compete on evidence gathering abilities and tools used.
Agencies are expanding nationally to increase revenue and client relationships.

concentration_points.concentration_description: The industry has many small companies, with 80% being non-employers.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Top companies have low market share
concentration_points.concentration_description: The top 3 companies account for less than 5% of industry revenue.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Low startup costs and moderate barriers
concentration_points.concentration_description: Low costs and moderate entry barriers allow new small operators to enter easily.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: The industry is largely reliant on labor. This industry requires relatively little capital as compared with other industries, and this is predominantly due to its reliance on employees' talents rather than capital equipment.
Purchases primarily comprises recording equipment, database subscriptions and other miscellaneous office equipment.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Relatively low capital expenditure in this industry is the result of labor-intensive day-to-day operations.
This industry does not have significant start-up costs, nor does it require much capital to begin operations.

volatility_points.volatility_description: The industry benefits from general macroeconomic growth, as corporate profit and per capita disposable income are primary drivers. But it also sees countercyclical demand during recessions.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The industry has been affected by a degree of technological change, mainly in the form of operators integrating new technologies into their existing services.
After reaching a quality threshold, private detectives gain little from purchasing the latest equipment relative to its cost, keeping technological change moderate.

FAQs.question: Has competition from low-wage countries hurt your business?
FAQs.answer: Competition from low-wage countries is virtually nonexistent. Operators work directly with clients and usually must be "on the ground" to successfully provide services.

FAQs.question: Are your company's sales heavily dependent on rising commercial construction activity?
FAQs.answer: Not directly, but since private detective services could include background checks on new tenants, there is a relationship between new units and industry sales. The industry is represented by the ALDONYS, a professional organization whose main objective is to promote the interest of its members by fostering a favorable image for the profession and providing a forum for the exchange of ideas between industry professionals.

FAQs.question: Is maintaining repeat or recurring customers vital to your company's success?
FAQs.answer: Maintaining repeat customers is important for success in the industry. As projects may be short-term, it is important for companies to maintain relationships with clients to receive multiple short-term requests.

FAQs.question: Is obtaining long-term contracts with customers essential to your business' success?
FAQs.answer: No, long-term contracts are not essential for this industry. Attracting repeat customers is important, as these customers can provide a steady revenue flow over time.

FAQs.question: Have you been able to reduce costs by automating operations?
FAQs.answer: While wages have actually increased relative to revenue over the past five years, technology has automated some processes, making it more efficient and quicker to access data. Nonetheless, automation does not play a major role in this industry.

FAQs.question: Does your company use mobile applications to improve client services and consumer experience?
FAQs.answer: This is not necessary as customers would not jump at the opportunity to download a mobile application for a service that is not used very often. Furthermore, communication between industry operator and the client could easily be done through email or telephone.

FAQs.question: Have energy-efficiency regulations positively impacted your business?
FAQs.answer: Environmental regulation has had little effect on the industry. The industry is a service-based industry.

FAQs.question: Is your business responsible for safeguarding customer information?
FAQs.answer: Companies may gain access to very sensitive data on clients and people they are investigating. As a result, companies must ensure the safety and protection of privacy or else risk litigation or reputation damage.

FAQs.question: How does your company compensate for seasonality of cash flow?
FAQs.answer: There generally is not a seasonality of cash flow. However, there is an inverse relationship between performance and the unemployment rate. A decreasing unemployment rate increases demand for pre-employment services.

FAQs.question: How frequently does your company purchase new equipment?
FAQs.answer: Companies generally do not have to undertake significant purchases. For example, a company can operate solely on computers and other basic IT equipment.

FAQs.question: How quickly can new technology be adopted? Does your company keep up to date with the latest technology? What are the associated costs?
FAQs.answer: Technology used by this industry changes rapidly, and technological aids are used for surveillance and intelligence and evidence gathering.

FAQs.question: How hard is it to promote your company by word-of-mouth? How can you improve your company to receive better word-of-mouth recommendations?
FAQs.answer: A lot of industry operators work as nonemployers and serve their local markets. Therefore, it is essential that they are able to attract local patronage for their services. Word of mouth is the most effective form of marketing for this industry. Therefore, to be recommended by clients, industry operators must have a good reputation.

FAQs.question: Do you have a strong reputation among customers? Are you known for your reliability and performance?
FAQs.answer: Having a good reputation. Word of mouth is the most effective form of marketing for this industry. Therefore, to be recommended by clients, industry operators must have a good reputation.

FAQs.question: Do you monitor corporate profit? Do you offer a variety of services to correlate with the different types of companies in your area?
FAQs.answer: When corporate profit levels rise, more companies have the resources to hire private detectives, resulting in an increase in industry revenue from business clients.

FAQs.question: How will your company respond to an expected increase in the number of US businesses?
FAQs.answer: As the number of businesses in the United States increases, demand for industry services rises because the pool of potential corporate clients grows.

FAQs.question: Do you monitor the crime rate? How much of your business stems from fraud claims?
FAQs.answer: When the crime rate increases, insurance companies are more likely to use industry services to identify cases of insurance fraud and legitimate claims.
